jsymbolic2.featureutils

Class CollectedNoteInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.featureutils.CollectedNoteInfo

  • public class CollectedNoteInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class holds information on the pitch, start, end, track and channel of notes parsed from a MIDI stream (including Channel 10 unpitched notes). Information on each note is stored in a separate NoteInfo object, and these are made accessible based on temporal location as specified by the MIDI tick on which a note started.
    Author:
    Tristano Tenaglia and Cory McKay

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CollectedNoteInfo()
      Instantiate a CollectedNoteInfo object that does not yet hold any notes.
      CollectedNoteInfo(javax.sound.midi.Track[] tracks)
      Instantiate a CollectedNoteInfo object holding all notes in the provided tracks.

      static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<NoteInfo>> noteListToStartTickNoteMap(java.util.List<NoteInfo> note_list)
      Convert a list of notes into a map indicating all notes starting on any given MIDI tick, where the start tick value serves as the map key and the map value is a list of all notes starting on the specified tick, on any track and on any channel.

      • CollectedNoteInfo

        public CollectedNoteInfo()
        Instantiate a CollectedNoteInfo object that does not yet hold any notes.

      • CollectedNoteInfo

        public CollectedNoteInfo(javax.sound.midi.Track[] tracks)
        Instantiate a CollectedNoteInfo object holding all notes in the provided tracks.
        Parameters:
        tracks - All the MIDI tracks loaded from the MIDI sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • addNote

        public final void addNote(NoteInfo this_note)
        Add a note to be stored and indexed in this object.
        Parameters:
        this_note - The note to be stored.

      • getNoteList

        public java.util.List<NoteInfo> getNoteList()
        Returns:
        A list of notes added to this object from a MIDI stream so far. Temporal order is not necessarily guaranteed.

      • getStartTickNoteMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<NoteInfo>> getStartTickNoteMap()
        Returns:
        A map holding all notes parsed from a MIDI stream so far. It stores all notes starting on any given MIDI tick, where the start tick value serves as the map key and the map value is a list of all notes starting on the specified tick, on any track and on any channel. The particular ordering of notes in this List value is not necessarily meaningful.

      • getNotesOnChannel

        public java.util.List<NoteInfo> getNotesOnChannel(int channel)
        Get a list of notes in a given MIDI channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - The MIDI channel to find notes from.
        Returns:
        A list of all notes added so far from a MIDI stream with the given channel number. Temporal order is not necessarily guaranteed.

      • getNotesStartingOnTick

        public java.util.List<NoteInfo> getNotesStartingOnTick(int tick)
        Get a list of notes starting on the given MIDI start_tick.
        Parameters:
        tick - The MIDI start_tick to find notes starting on.
        Returns:
        A list holding all notes parsed from a MIDI stream so far that start at the specified MIDI tick. The particular ordering of notes in this list is not necessarily meaningful.

      • noteListToStartTickNoteMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<NoteInfo>> noteListToStartTickNoteMap(java.util.List<NoteInfo> note_list)
        Convert a list of notes into a map indicating all notes starting on any given MIDI tick, where the start tick value serves as the map key and the map value is a list of all notes starting on the specified tick, on any track and on any channel. The particular ordering of notes in this List value is not necessarily meaningful.
        Parameters:
        note_list - The list of notes to populate the returned object with.
        Returns:
        The map linking MIDI ticks to the notes that start on those ticks.

      • noteListToSortedNoteList

        public static java.util.List<NoteInfo> noteListToSortedNoteList(java.util.List<NoteInfo> note_list)
        Return a copy of the the given list of notes sorted in increasing order by start tick. Note that the original list is not changed in any way.
        Parameters:
        note_list - The list of notes to sort.
        Returns:
        The sorted copy.
